info.question: What AWS compute service is defined as 'virtual machines inside AWS'?

What AWS storage service is a virtual appliance/machine that you install in your data center that replicates data into S3?

What AWS migration service is used for migrating large amounts of data to AWS?

What AWS network and content delivery service gives you a way of creating APIs for other services to talk to?
What AWS network and content delivery service gives you a way of running a dedicated line from your on-premise data center to your AWS VPC?

What AWS management tool uses both Chef and Puppet to automate your environments and the configuration of your environments?
What AWS management tool manages a catelog of your account resources that are approved for use in your AWS account?
What AWS management tool is used for governance and compliance requirements for your AQS account?

What AWS management tool is used for EC2 for things like patch maintenance?
What AWS management tool would you use to install a patch across thousands of EC2 instances all at once?
What AWS management tool gives you advice around security, cost optimization, performance, and fault tolerance?
What AWS management tool lets AWS manage your EC2 instances, auto-scaling, load balancers, etc?
What AWS media service transcodes videos so they appear correctly across all device types?
What AWS media service is a file based video transcoding service?
What AWS media service is live video processing service?
What AWS media service prepares and protects videos for transfer over the internet?
What AWS media service is a storage service that's optimized for video?
What AWS media service allows targeted advertising in video streams?

What AWS machine learning service does sentiment analysis of your data?
What AWS machine learning service is an artificially aware camera that can figure out what it's looking at using deep learning?
What AWS machine learning service is service that powers Alexa?
What AWS machine learning service provides an artificially intelligent chat capability?
What AWS machine learning service is a less sophisticated 'learning' tool than deep learning that uses data set analysis to predict outcome when new data sets are applied to it?
What AWS machine learning service is the service that Amazon uses to recommend new products to its users?
What AWS machine learning service takes text and turns it into speech?
What AWS machine learning service provides video and image contect recognition?
What AWS machine learning service is Amazon's machine translation service which translates one language into another?
What AWS machine learning service automates speech recognition to produce transcription of video audio?

Once authenticated you can use this AWS security service to request temporary access to AWS resources like DynamoDB tables?

What AWS security service monitors for malicious activity on your AWS account?

What AWS security service generates reports giving severity list of vulnerabilities in your EC2 instances?
What AWS security service scans your S3 buckets and looks for personal identifiable information (PII)?
What AWS security service gives you a way to manage your SSL certificates?
What AWS security service gives you your SSL certificates for free if you register your domain through Route 53?

What AWS security service is like a layer 7 firewall which stops cross-site scripting, sql injection and looks at the application layer to detect malicious user behavior?
What AWS security service do you get by default when using CloudFront, load balancers, and Route 53?
What AWS security services give you DDoS mitigation?
What AWS security service gives you a dedicated 24x7 team to help you prevent DDoS attacks?

What AWS security service can be used to manage compliance agreements and you can use it to download SOC controls reports or Payment Card Industry reports?

What AWS mobile service is a way of using targeted push notifications to drive mobile engagement?
What AWS mobile service updates data in web and mobile applications in real time and updates data for offline users as soon as they reconnect?
What AWS mobile service gives you a way of testing your apps on real live devices?
What AWS mobile service gives you an analytics service for mobile?
What AWS AR/VR service is used for AR and VR application design and allows you to use a common set of tools to create these environments?
What AWS application integration service gives you a way of managing your Lambda functions by using steps to move through them?
What AWS application integration service gives you a way of passing data through message queues?

What AWS application integration service is a way of decoupling your infrastructure through queues?
What AWS application integration service is a way of managing a workflow such as package order processing in a warehouse?

What AWS customer engagement service is a way of sending large amounts of email?
What AWS business productivity service can be used to start your meeting by dialing into a meeting room?
What AWS business productivity service is a video conferencing service?

What AWS internet of things service gives you a way to manage iOT devices at scale?
What AWS internet of things service gives you an operating system for your microcontrollers?

What AWS game development service is a service to help you build games in the AWS cloud?

Company salespeople upload their sales figures daily. A Solutions Architect needs a durable storage solution for these documents that also protects against users accidentally deleting important documents. Which action will protect against unintended user actions?
answers: Put the access key in an S3 bucket, and retrieve the access key on boot from the instance
Pass the access key to the instances through instance user data
Obtain the access key from a key server launched in a private subnet
Create an IAM role with permissions to access the table, and launch all instances with the new role
correctAnswer: Create an IAM role with permissions to access the table, and launch all instances with the new role

info.question: A company is developing a highly available web application using stateless web servers. Which services are suitable for storing session state data?

Company salespeople upload their sales figures daily. A Solutions Architect needs a durable storage solution for these documents that also protects against users accidentally deleting important documents. Which action will protect against unintended user actions?
answers: Store data in an EBS volume and create snapshots once a week
Store data in an S3 bucket and enable versioning
Store data in two S3 buckets in different AWS regions
Store data on EC2 instance storage
correctAnswer: Store data in an S3 bucket and enable versioning

info.question: An application requires a highly available relational database with an initial storage capacity of 8 TB. The database will grow by 8 GB every day. To support expected traffic, at least eight read replicas will be required to handle database reads. Which option will meet these requirements?

A Solutions Architect is designing a critical business application with a relational database that runs on an EC2 instance. It requires a single EBS volume that can support up to 16,000 IOPS. Which Amazon EBS volume type can meet the performance requirements of this application?

A web application allows customers to upload orders to an S3 bucket. The resulting Amazon S3 events trigger a Lambda function that inserts a message to an SQS queue. A single EC2 instance reads messages from the queue, processes them, and stores them in an DynamoDB table partitioned by unique order ID. Next month traffic is expected to increase by a factor of 10 and a Solutions Architect is reviewing the architecture for possible scaling problems. Which component is MOST likely to need re-architecting to be able to scale to accommodate the new traffic?
An application saves the logs to an S3 bucket. A user wants to keep the logs for one month for troubleshooting purposes, and then purge the logs. What feature will enable this?
answers: Adding a bucket policy on the S3 bucket
Configuring lifecycle configuration rules on the S3 bucket
Creating an IAM policy for the S3 bucket
Enabling CORS on the S3 bucket
correctAnswer: Configuring lifecycle configuration rules on the S3 bucket

info.question: An application running on EC2 instances processes sensitive information stored on Amazon S3. The information is accessed over the Internet. The security team is concerned that the Internet connectivity to Amazon S3 is a security risk. Which solution will resolve the security concern?
answers: Access the data through an Internet Gateway
Access the data through a VPN connection
Access the data through a NAT Gateway
Access the data through a VPC endpoint for Amazon S3
correctAnswer: Access the data through a VPC endpoint for Amazon S3

info.question: An organization is building an Amazon Redshift cluster in their shared services VPC. The cluster will host sensitive data. How can the organization control which networks can access the cluster?
answers: Run the cluster in a different VPC and connect through VPC peering
Create a database user inside the Amazon Redshift cluster only for users on the network
Define a cluster security group for the cluster that allows access from the allowed networks
Only allow access to networks that connect with the shared services network via VPN
correctAnswer: Define a cluster security group for the cluster that allows access from the allowed networks

info.question: A Solutions Architect is designing an online shopping application running in a VPC on EC2 instances behind an ELB Application Load Balancer. The instances run in an Auto Scaling group across multiple Availability Zones. The application tier must read and write data to a customer managed database cluster. There should be no access to the database from the Internet, but the cluster must be able to obtain software patches from the Internet. Which VPC design meets these requirements?
answers: Public subnets for both the application tier and the database cluster
Public subnets for the application tier, and private subnets for the database cluster
Public subnets for the application tier and NAT Gateway, and private subnets for the database cluster
Public subnets for the application tier, and private subnets for the database cluster and NAT Gateway
correctAnswer: Public subnets for the application tier and NAT Gateway, and private subnets for the database cluster

info.question: What security service securely controls access to AWS services and resources?
What security service gives you policy-based management for multiple AWS accounts?
What security service allows you to add user sign-up, sign-in, and access control to your web and mobile apps?
What security service gives you managed Microsoft Active Directory in the AWS cloud?
What security service gives you the ability to centrally manage single sign-on (SSO) access to multiple AWS accounts and business applications?
What security service gives you the ability to easily configure and manage Amazon EC2 and on-premise systems to apply OS patches, create secure system images, and configure secure operating systems?
What security service gives you managed DDoS protection service that safeguards web applications running on AWS?
What security service protects your web applications from common web exploits ensuring availability and security?
What security service automates security assessments to help improve the security and compliance of applications deployed on AWS?
What security service provisions a logically isolated section of AWS where you can launch AWS resources in a virtual network that you define?
What security service enables governance, compliance, and operational/risk auditing of your AWS account?
What security service records and evaluates configurations of your AWS resources, enabling compliance auditing, security analysis, resource change tracking, and troubleshooting?
What security service monitors AWS cloud resources and your applications on AWS to collect metrics, monitor log files, set alarms, and automatically react to changes?
What security service provides intelligent threat detection and continuous monitoring to protect your AWS accounts and workloads?
What security service captures information about the IP traffic going to and from network interfaces in your VPC, log data is stored using Amazon CloudWatch logs?
What security service is a security service that uses machine learning to automatically discover, classify, and protect sensitive data in AWS?
What is IAM?
answers: Allows you to manage users and their level of access to the AWS console
Gives you control of billing alarms
Gives you authority over combined billing
correctAnswer: Allows you to manage users and their level of access to the AWS console

info.question: IAM gives you which of the following?
answers: Centralized control of your AWS account
Identity federation (including Active Directory, Facebook, Linkedin, etc.)
correctAnswer: Centralized control of your AWS account
Identity federation (including Active Directory, Facebook, Linkedin, etc.)

info.question: IAM gives you which of the following?
answers: Shared access to your AWS account
Provide temporary access for users/devices and services
correctAnswer: Shared access to your AWS account
Provide temporary access for users/devices and services

info.question: In IAM what is a user?
answers: Permanent resource that access AWS resources
A collection of users under one set of permissions
A temporary entity (person or machine/software) in the IAM service
A document that defines one or more permissions
correctAnswer: Permanent resource that access AWS resources

info.question: In IAM what is a group?
answers: Permanent resource that access AWS resources
A collection of users under one set of permissions
A temporary entity (person or machine/software) in the IAM service
A document that defines one or more permissions
correctAnswer: A collection of users under one set of permissions

info.question: In IAM what is a role?
answers: Permanent resource that access AWS resources
A collection of users under one set of permissions
A temporary entity (person or machine/software) in the IAM service
A document that defines one or more permissions
correctAnswer: A temporary entity (person or machine/software) in the IAM service

info.question: In IAM what is a policy?
answers: Permanent resource that access AWS resources
A collection of users under one set of permissions
A temporary entity (person or machine/software) in the IAM service
A document that defines one or more permissions
correctAnswer: A document that defines one or more permissions

info.question: IAM is a _____ resource, not associated with any particular region?
Your account number is embedded in what IAM property, which you can customize to an account alias?
Which apps can you use as an MFA tool with IAM for iOS and Windows phones?
Which keys do you use to programatically use AWS services through the CLI and APIs?
You can use the Access Key ID and Secret Access Key to login to the AWS console?
You can use the Access Key ID and Secret Access Key for programatic access to AWS resources?
In IAM you use which feature to manage passwords?
The IAM dashboard Security Tasks are which of these?
answers: Activate MFA on your Root account
correctAnswer: Activate MFA on your Root account

info.question: In IAM, _____ are a way to grant permissions to entities you trust?
In IAM you can use roles to do which of these?
answers: Allow an IAM user from another account to access resources in this account
Allow application code running in an EC2 instance that needs to perform actions on AWS resources (like S3)
Allow an AWS service that needs to act on resources in your account to provide its features
Allow users from a corporate directory who use identity federation with SAML
Allow users to create billing alarms
correctAnswer: Allow an IAM user from another account to access resources in this account
Allow application code running in an EC2 instance that needs to perform actions on AWS resources (like S3)
Allow an AWS service that needs to act on resources in your account to provide its features
Allow users from a corporate directory who use identity federation with SAML

info.question: In IAM roles issue keys that are _____, making them a more secure way to grant access?
Which AWS service do you use to monitor billing through Billing Alarms using Billing Alerts?
IAM consists of the following?
In IAM you can apply ______ to users, groups, and roles?
In IAM policy documents are made up of ______ containing key: value pairs?
In IAM new users have what level of permissions when they are first created?
In IAM new users are assigned what when they are first created?
In IAM you can create and customize your own what?
What is an AWS region?
answers: A region is an independent data center, located in different countries around the globe.
A region is a geographical area that consists of different availability zones. Each region at least two Availability Zones.
A region is a collection of Edge Locations available in specific countries.
A region consists of different subsets of AWS technologies. For example the compute region consists of EC2, ECS, Lambda, etc.
correctAnswer: A region is a geographical area that consists of different availability zones. Each region at least two Availability Zones.

info.question: What does an AWS Region consist of?
answers: A console that gives you quick, global picture of your cloud computing environment.
A collection of databases that can only be accessed from a specific geographic region.
An independent collection of AWS computing resources in a defined geography.
A distinct location within a geographic area designed to provide high availability to a specific geography.
A content distribution network, which is used to distribute content to users.
correctAnswer: An independent collection of AWS computing resources in a defined geography.

info.question: Which statement best describes Availability Zones?
answers: Availability Zones are Content Distribution Networks.
A restricted area designed specifically for creating Virtual Private Clouds.
Two zones containing compute resources that are designed to automatically maintain synchronized copies of each other's data.
Distinct locations from within an AWS region that are engineered to be isolated from failures.
correctAnswer: Distinct locations from within an AWS region that are engineered to be isolated from failures.

info.question: An AWS VPC is a component of which AWS service?
What is a VPC?
Which AWS service is specifically designed to run a developer's code on an infrastructure that is automatically provisioned to host that code?
Which AWS service allows you to run code without having to worry about provisioning any underlying resources (such as virtual machines, databases, etc.)
Amazon's highly scaleable DNS service is known as ________.
Which AWS compute service is specifically designed to assist you in processing large data sets?
What is the difference between Elastic Beanstalk & CloudFormation?
answers: Elastic Beanstalk is a monitoring tool to view the performance of your AWS resources, where as CloudFormation is an automated provisioning engine designed to deploy entire cloud environments via a JSON script.

Elastic Beanstalk automatically handles the deployment, from capacity provisioning, load balancing, auto-scaling to application health monitoring based on the code you upload to it, where as CloudFormation is a security service designed to harden your cloud against an attack such as a DDOS

Elastic Beanstalk automatically handles the deployment, from capacity provisioning, load balancing, auto-scaling to application health monitoring based on the code you upload to it, where as CloudFormation is an automated provisioning engine designed to deploy entire cloud environments via a JSON script.
There is no difference between the two. Elastic Beanstalk was simply the code name used internally for CloudFormation, prior to the product being released.
correctAnswer: Elastic Beanstalk automatically handles the deployment, from capacity provisioning, load balancing, auto-scaling to application health monitoring based on the code you upload to it, where as CloudFormation is an automated provisioning engine designed to deploy entire cloud environments via a JSON script.

info.question: Which AWS service is used as a CDN to distribute content around the world?
Which of the following AWS solutions offers durable, available storage for flat files?
Which of the following AWS services would be the best choice for long term data archival?
Which AWS service offers the following database engines: SQL, MySQL, MariaDB, PostgreSQL, Aurora, and Oracle?
Which of the following AWS services is used primarily for data warehousing?
Which AWS service is used for collating large amounts of data streamed from multiple sources?
You need to add users to your AWS account and set password rotation policies for these new users. Which AWS service would best fit your requirements?
You need to supply auditors with logs detailing the individual users that provision specific resources on your AWS platform. Which service would best meet this need?
You need a configuration management service that enables your system administrators to configure and operate your web applications using Chef. Which AWS service would best suit your needs?
Your digital media agency needs to convert their media files in to different formats to suit different devices. Which AWS service should you consider using to meet these needs?
Which statement best describes IAM
answers: IAM allows you to manage users, groups, roles, and their corresponding level of access to the AWS Platform.
IAM allows you to manage users passwords only. AWS staff must create new users for your organisation. This is done by raising a ticket.
IAM allows you to manage permissions for AWS resources only.
IAM stands for Improvised Application Management and it allows you to deploy and manage applications in the AWS Cloud.
correctAnswer: IAM allows you to manage users, groups, roles, and their corresponding level of access to the AWS Platform.

info.question: Which of the following is not a feature of IAM?
answers: Centralised control of your AWS account
Integrates with existing active directory account allowing single sign on
Fine-grained access control to AWS resources
Allows you to set up your own password rotation policy
Allows you to setup biometric authentication, so that no passwords are required
correctAnswer: Allows you to setup biometric authentication, so that no passwords are required

info.question: Power User Access allows ________.
answers: Full Access to all AWS services and resources
Read Only access to all AWS services and resources
Access to all AWS services except for management of groups and users within IAM
Users to inspect the source code of the AWS platform
correctAnswer: Access to all AWS services except for management of groups and users within IAM

info.question: What level of access does the 'root' account have?

You are a solutions architect working for a large engineering company who are moving their existing legacy hardware to AWS. You have configured their first AWS account and you have set up IAM. Your company will be primarily based out of West Germany, however they will have a small subsidiary operating out of South Korea and you will need an AWS environment configured there as well. Which of the following statements is true?
answers: You will then need to configure Users and Policy Documents for each region respectively.
You will need to configure Users and Policy Documents only once, as these are applied globally.
You will need to configure your users regionally, however your policy documents are global.
You will need to configure your policy documents regionally, however your users are global.
correctAnswer: You will need to configure Users and Policy Documents only once, as these are applied globally.

info.question: You have a client who is considering moving to AWS services and do not yet have an account. What is the first thing the company should do to set up an AWS Account?
answers: Set up an account using Cloud Search.
Set up an account using their company email address.
Set up an account via SQS (Simple Queue Service)
Set up an account via SNS (Simple Notification Service)
correctAnswer: Set up an account using their company email address.

info.question: You are a security administrator working for a hotel chain. You have a new member of staff who has started as a systems administrator and they will need full access to the AWS console. You have created the user account and generated the access key id and the secret access key. You have moved this user into the group where the other administrators are and you have provided the new user with their secret access key and their access key id. However when they go to log in to the AWS console, they cannot sign in. What could be the cause of this?
answers: You have not applied the 'log in from console' policy document to the user. You must apply this first so that they can log in.
Your user is trying to log in from the AWS console from outside the corporate network. This is not possible.
You have not yet activated multi-factor authentication for the user, so by default they will not be able to log in.

You cannot log in to the AWS console using the Access Key ID and Secret Access Key, instead you must generate a password for the user and supply the user with this password, as well as the unique link to sign in to the AWS console.
correctAnswer: You cannot log in to the AWS console using the Access Key ID and Secret Access Key, instead you must generate a password for the user and supply the user with this password, as well as the unique link to sign in to the AWS console.

info.question: What is an additional way to secure IAM for both the root login and new users alike?
answers: Implement multi-factor Authentication for all accounts.
Store the access key id and secret access key of all users in a publically accessible plain text document on S3 of which only you and members of your organisation know the address to.
Configure the AWS console so that you can only log in to it from a specific IP Address range
Configure the AWS console so that you can only log in to it from your internal network IP address range.
correctAnswer: Implement multi-factor Authentication for all accounts.

info.question: By default when you create a new user in the IAM console, what level of access do they have?
answers: Read only access to all AWS services.
No access to all AWS services.
Administrator access to all AWS services.
Power user access to all AWS services
correctAnswer: No access to all AWS services.

info.question: In what language are policy documents written?
